title: Cops Leaked Anna University Sexual Assault Victim's Identity, Alleges Tamil Nadu BJP - News18
summary:
Tamil Nadu BJP Condemns Identity Leak of Anna University Sexual Assault Victim

Date: December 26, 2024

Source: News18

The Tamil Nadu BJP has accused the state's police of leaking the identity of a sexual assault victim connected to an incident at Anna University, where a 19-year-old student was attacked.

  • The incident took place on December 23, with the victim's details allegedly made public through the FIR.
  • BJP leader Annamalai has urged action against the officials responsible for this breach.
  • The accused is reportedly linked to DMK’s local leadership and has a history of similar crimes.
  • DMK leaders have denied the allegations, insisting the accused is not a primary member of their party.

“This heinous and imprudent act of the TN police is a blatant breach of the rights of the victim.” – Annamalai

The BJP is calling for urgent reform and accountability in handling sensitive cases involving victims of sexual assault.
newTitle: Tamil Nadu BJP Condemns Identity Leak of Anna University Sexual Assault Victim

title: Govt considers income tax relief for those earning up to Rs 15 lakh: Report - The Times of India
China approves world’s largest, $137-billion dam on the Brahmaputra close to the Indian border - The Hindu
summary:
China Approves Construction of World's Largest Dam on the Brahmaputra River

Published on December 26, 2024 by The Hindu

China has approved the construction of the world’s largest dam, costing $137 billion, on the Brahmaputra River in Tibet, close to the Indian border, raising concerns among neighboring countries.

  • The dam is planned to be built at a gorge where the Brahmaputra makes a U-turn into India and then flows into Bangladesh.
  • It is part of China’s 14th Five-Year Plan and seeks to control water flow in the region, elevating fears of potential flooding during conflicts.
  • The dam will have the ability to generate over 300 billion kWh of electricity annually — enough for 300 million people.
  • The project poses significant engineering challenges due to its location along a tectonic plate boundary.
  • The Chinese government emphasizes the project’s role in environmental sustainability and national security, alongside providing significant economic benefits to the Tibet region.
“The lower reaches area features a vertical drop of 2,000 metres over a 50km distance, representing nearly 70 million kilowatts of resources that could be developed.” - Yan Zhiyong, Chairman of Power Construction Corporation of China

This dam not only focuses on hydropower but also aims to promote cooperation in South Asia and enhance energy resources.
newTitle: China Approves Construction of World's Largest Dam on the Brahmaputra River

'Need to give chance to new power, leadership': Mallikarjun Kharge at CWC meet after assembly polls debac - The Times of India
summary:
Need to give chance to new power, leadership: Mallikarjun Kharge at CWC meet after assembly polls debacle

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Not Specified

During a recent Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting, leader Mallikarjun Kharge emphasized the need for leadership change following the party's performance in the assembly polls. He called for a new approach to revitalize the party's image and outreach.

  • Kharge stresses new leadership is essential after recent electoral setbacks.
  • Focus on revitalizing the Congress party's approach to connect with voters.
  • Calls for introspection and strategic planning to regain lost ground.
“We must give a chance to new power and leadership to reinvigorate our party.”

This meeting marks a significant moment for the Congress party as it seeks to address its challenges and reshape its future direction.
newTitle: Need to give chance to new power, leadership: Mallikarjun Kharge at CWC meet after assembly polls debacle

Budget 2025: Govt may cut income tax rates to lift consumption, say report - Business Standard
summary:
Budget 2025: India Considers Income Tax Cuts to Boost Consumption

Publication Date: January 2025  Source: Reuters

India is looking into potential income tax reductions for individuals earning up to Rs 15 lakh to support the middle class and stimulate consumption amid economic challenges.

  • The proposal aims to aid millions of taxpayers, particularly in urban areas facing high living costs.
  • Taxpayers have the option to choose between two tax systems: one allowing exemptions and the other with lower rates but no major exemptions.
  • A final decision on the cuts will be made closer to the budget announcement on February 1.
"More money in the hands of the middle class might help rev up the economy."

While the government grapples with high inflation and political pressure regarding tax rates, the proposed cuts aim to alleviate the financial burdens faced by many.
newTitle: Budget 2025: India Considers Income Tax Cuts to Boost Consumption

Supreme Court Collegium recommends advocate Pravin Sheshrao Patil as Judge of Bombay High Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Collegium recommends advocate Pravin Sheshrao Patil as Judge of Bombay High Court

Published on: 26 Dec 2024, 10:42 am

The Supreme Court collegium has recommended the elevation of advocate Pravin Sheshrao Patil as a judge of the Bombay High Court.

  • The recommendation was made at a meeting held on December 22, 2024.
  • The official statement from the Collegium confirmed the proposal for Sheshrao Patil's appointment.
  • The Bombay High Court currently has 67 judges, leaving 27 vacancies from its sanctioned total of 94 judges.
  • Other high courts are also receiving new judge appointments, including Allahabad, Rajasthan, and Uttarakhand.
"The Supreme Court Collegium in its meeting held on 22nd December, 2024 has approved the proposal for appointment of Shri Pravin Sheshrao Patil, Advocate, as a Judge of the High Court of Bombay."

This move is expected to help fill the judicial vacancies in the Bombay High Court, enhancing its capability to address cases effectively.
newTitle: Supreme Court Collegium Recommends Pravin Sheshrao Patil as Judge of Bombay High Court

title: Embarrassing Moments Of 2024 When Judges Sparked Controversies With Unthoughtful Comments - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Embarrassing Moments Of 2024 When Judges Sparked Controversies With Unthoughtful Comments

Publication Date: 2024-12-10 | Source: Live Law

This article discusses various embarrassing moments in 2024 when judges made controversial remarks that led to judicial scrutiny, underscoring the challenges of public perception in a digital age.

  • Justice BV Nagarathna criticized judges for being active on social media.
  • Former judge Abhijit Gangopadhyay resigned to join the BJP, raising questions of judicial independence.
  • Justice Rajbir Sehrawat from Punjab and Haryana High Court made disparaging comments about the Supreme Court.
  • Justice Vedavyasachar Srishananda exhibited communal and gender biases in court statements.
  • Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav faced backlash for remarks made during a VHP event.
“Judicial discipline in the context of the hierarchical nature of the judicial system is intended to preserve the dignity of all institutions.”

The events highlighted in 2024 illustrate the ongoing issues surrounding judicial accountability and public expectations in the age of social media.
newTitle: Judges and Controversies: Unthoughtful Remarks in 2024

title: Collegium recommends appointment of advocate Praveen Kumar Giri as Allahabad High Court judge - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Collegium Recommends Praveen Kumar Giri as Judge of Allahabad High Court

Published on: 26 Dec 2024, 10:29 am

The Supreme Court Collegium has recommended the appointment of advocate Praveen Kumar Giri as a judge of the Allahabad High Court.

The decision was taken by the Collegium headed by Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna on December 22.

"The Supreme Court Collegium in its meeting held on 22nd December, 2024 has approved the proposal for appointment of Shri Praveen Kumar Giri, Advocate, as a Judge of the High Court of Judicature at Allahabad," the resolution said.

As on December 1, the Allahabad High Court is functioning with 81 judges as against its sanctioned strength of 160, a vacancy position of 79.

This appointment highlights the ongoing efforts to fill judicial vacancies in the Allahabad High Court.
newTitle: Collegium Recommends Praveen Kumar Giri as Judge of Allahabad High Court

title: Three-year-old girl trapped in Rajasthan's borewell for over 70 hours: What happened so far - Hindustan Times
summary:
Three-Year-Old Girl Trapped in Borewell for Over 70 Hours in Rajasthan

Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A three-year-old girl named Chetna has been trapped in a 700-foot borewell in Rajasthan for over 70 hours while playing near her father's farm. Rescue operations are currently ongoing with teams working tirelessly to extricate her safely.

  • Chetna fell into the borewell around 3 PM on Monday.
  • Rescue teams, including the NDRF and SDRF, were formed and began operations within hours of the incident.
  • Efforts have included digging a parallel tunnel to reach the girl and overcoming challenges posed by compact soil due to moisture.
  • On Tuesday, rescuers managed to pull her up 30 feet and are continuously providing oxygen.
  • The rescue operation has reached a critical phase, and officials hope for a successful outcome soon.
Yogesh Kumar Meena, NDRF team in charge, stated, "We have to dig to 170 m deep down to reach the trapped girl."

Authorities remain hopeful for her safe rescue as efforts continue amidst challenging conditions.
newTitle: Three-Year-Old Girl Trapped in Borewell for Over 70 Hours in Rajasthan

title: ‘Ishwar Allah tero naam’: Protest erupts over bhajan at Vajpayee tribute event in Patna, BJP’s Shahnawaz Hussain calls it ‘height of intolerance’ - The Indian Express
summary:
‘Ishwar Allah tero naam’: Protest erupts over bhajan at Vajpayee tribute event in Patna

Date: Not specified
Source: The Indian Express

At a Patna function to commemorate the life of former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, a protest erupted when noted folk singer Devi sang the lines “Ishwar Allah tero naam” during her rendition of Raghupati Raghav Raja Ram.

  • Around 50 protesters disrupted the singing of the bhajan closely associated with Mahatma Gandhi.
  • BJP leader Shahnawaz Hussain labeled the protest as “the height of intolerance.”
  • Event organizer Ashwini Kumar Choubey condemned the disruption, stating it should not have occurred.
  • Singer Devi expressed her disappointment over the protest against a revered bhajan.
  • Participants in the event included former Union ministers under Vajpayee's government.
“What happened was unfortunate.” - Folk singer Devi
“The protest of the bhajan is the height of intolerance.” - Shahnawaz Hussain

The event aimed to honor Vajpayee's contributions, but the protest highlights ongoing tensions regarding religious expressions in public commemorations.
newTitle: Protest Erupts Over Bhajan at Vajpayee Tribute Event in Patna

title: He took retirement for wife; she collapsed at his farewell! they took her to hospital, but she was… - India.com
summary:
He took retirement for wife; she collapsed at his farewell! they took her to hospital, but she was…

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: India.com

A heart-wrenching incident unfolded in Kota, Rajasthan, when a government employee’s farewell party turned into a tragedy. Devendra had taken voluntary retirement to care for his ailing wife, Deepika, but tragically, she collapsed and passed away during the celebration.

Key Points:

  • Devendra dedicated his retirement to caring for his wife, who had health issues.
  • The farewell party, meant to celebrate his retirement, ended in disaster as Deepika collapsed.
  • A video of the incident went viral, showing the couple moments before the collapse.
  • Despite immediate help, Deepika was pronounced dead at the hospital.
  • Public reactions on social media expressed grief and suggestions for emergency preparedness.
"राजस्थान के कोटा जिला में एक भावुक घटना घटित पत्नी की देखभाल के लिए वॉलंटरी रिटायरमेंट लिया, लेकिन रिटायरमेंट का जश्न मनाते हुए पत्नी ने इस दुनिया को अलविदा कह दिया।"
— Banwari Lal – Bairwa (Civil Engineer)

The incident reveals the profound unpredictability of life during significant moments and highlights Devendra's commitment.
newTitle: Tragic Farewell: Man's Retirement Celebration Turns to Heartbreak in Rajasthan

title: ‘Sankranthi movies, ticket hikes, benefit shows are unimportant now’: Dil Raju after meeting Telangana CM Revanth Reddy - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘Sankranthi movies, ticket hikes, benefit shows are unimportant now’: Dil Raju after meeting Telangana CM Revanth Reddy

Publication Date: Dec 26, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Representatives from the Telugu film industry, including producer Dil Raju, met with Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy to explore ways of collaboration for the growth of the industry. The discussion highlighted the need for Hyderabad to become an international movie hub.

  • The meeting focused on strengthening the partnership between the film industry and the government.
  • CM Reddy expressed the desire for international films to be shot in Hyderabad.
  • Raju emphasized the importance of supporting social causes such as drug awareness and women’s safety.
  • The CM announced the discontinuation of benefit shows and ticket hikes in the wake of recent incidents.
“Sankranthi movies, benefit shows, and ticket hikes are unimportant. Today's agenda was to discuss how to make Hyderabad an international movie hub.” - Dil Raju

The collaboration aims to address various issues facing both sectors and to align their goals for the future growth of the film industry in Telangana.
newTitle: Telugu Film Industry Leaders Meet Telangana CM to Discuss Future Plans

title: Maharashtra Govt Hikes Charges For High Security Number Plates, Check New Rates Here - News18
summary:
Maharashtra Increases Fees for High-Security Number Plates – New Rates Revealed

Publication Date: December 26, 2024, Source: News18 Hindi

Car and bike owners in Maharashtra will now have to pay more for High-Security Number Plates (HSRP) for vehicles registered before April 1, 2019, following a recent announcement by the Maharashtra Transport Department.

  • The installation cost for two-wheelers (motorcycles, scooters, tractors) is Rs 531.
  • The cost for three-wheelers (auto-rickshaws) is Rs 590.
  • Larger vehicles (cars, buses, trucks, and more) will now incur a fee of Rs 879.
  • HSRP includes unique identification features to enhance security against forgery.
  • The Maharashtra Transport Department has activated a payment link for the new rates.
“The High-Security Registration Plate (HSRP) is designed to be tamper-proof and difficult to duplicate.”

The state transport department has provided an appointment facility on its website for installing HSRP on old vehicles, aiming to improve vehicle registration security.
newTitle: Maharashtra Increases Fees for High-Security Number Plates – New Rates Revealed

Indian CEO warns people not to fall for 'startup romance', shares harsh reality - Hindustan Times
summary:
Indian CEO warns of the harsh realities behind 'startup romance'

Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Radhika Gupta, CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, warns against the glamorization of startup culture, highlighting the difficult realities that come with entrepreneurship.

  • Startup culture in India has significantly grown, attracting many young individuals towards entrepreneurship.
  • Gupta advises against the 'startup romance' perception that depicts startup life as easy and glamorous.
  • She outlines the harsh truths of startup life, including execution pain, budget constraints, and the stress of constant rejection.
  • The reaction on social media is mixed, with differing opinions on the risks and rewards of starting a business.
“Startup reality hits soon. It means painful execution, limited budgets and even more limited working conditions...” - Radhika Gupta

This warning from the CEO encourages prospective entrepreneurs to realistically evaluate the challenges of startup life, despite its appealing facade.
newTitle: Indian CEO warns of the harsh realities behind 'startup romance'

title: IPS Officer, who was posted SSP Srinagar , now posted as DCP of important district in Delhi - Cross Town News
'Will ask INDIA bloc parties to remove Congress from alliance,' says AAP - The Times of India
CCPA fines three coaching institutes for misleading UPSC exam claims | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
CCPA fines three coaching institutes for misleading UPSC exam claims

Date: Dec 26, 2023

Source: PTI

The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has imposed penalties totalling ₹15 lakh on three coaching institutes for making misleading advertisements about their success rates in civil services examinations.

  • Vajirao & Reddy Institute and StudyIQ IAS were each fined ₹700,000.
  • Edge IAS was penalised ₹100,000 for deceptive claims regarding their results in the UPSC Civil Services Examinations.
  • The CCPA found that the institutes misrepresented the effectiveness of their courses by concealing that successful candidates had only enrolled in Interview Guidance Programs.
  • The CCPA has issued 45 notices to various coaching institutes for misleading advertisements, totaling ₹71.6 lakh in penalties from 22 institutes to date.
The advertisements that deliberately conceal important information are classified as misleading and subject to penalties under the Consumer Protection Act, 2019.

This action highlights the CCPA's commitment to curbing misleading practices in the educational sector and protecting consumer rights.
newTitle: CCPA fines three coaching institutes for misleading UPSC exam claims

title: AAP Says Will Ask INDIA Bloc To Remove Congress From Alliance If... - NDTV
summary:
AAP Threatens to Remove Congress from INDIA Alliance Over Ajay Maken Controversy

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In a major setback for opposition unity, the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has announced intentions to request Congress's removal from the INDIA alliance if it does not take action against its Delhi leader, Ajay Maken.

  • AAP accuses Congress of facilitating BJP's electoral success ahead of the Delhi Assembly elections.
  • Allegations arise that Ajay Maken's statements align with BJP's agenda.
  • The face-off follows previous cooperation between AAP and Congress during the Lok Sabha elections.
  • AAP demands action against Maken within 24 hours or will seek Congress's removal from the alliance.
“All limits have been crossed,” said MP Sanjay Singh regarding Maken’s comments.

This situation highlights growing tensions within the opposition, as AAP asserts its stance against Congress's perceived alignment with BJP interests.
newTitle: AAP Threatens to Remove Congress from INDIA Alliance Over Ajay Maken Controversy

title: Over 260 Canadian Colleges, Rs 60 Lakh Per Person: Trafficking Of Indians Into US Under ED Lens - News18
summary:
Over 260 Canadian Colleges Under Investigation for Trafficking Indians to the US

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: News18

The Enforcement Directorate (ED) is investigating a human trafficking and money laundering scheme involving 262 Canadian colleges, accused of facilitating the illegal migration of Indians to the US through student visas. Allegations point to charges of up to 60 lakh INR per person for crossing the border.

  • The investigation is linked to a tragic incident where a family died while attempting to enter the US illegally from Canada.
  • ED's probe started from an FIR against main accused Bhavesh Ashokbhai Patel.
  • Patel allegedly led a conspiracy to traffick Indians via falsified college admissions in Canada.
  • Indians were charged between Rs 55-60 lakh for this service.
  • The investigation has revealed extensive networks involving thousands of agents connecting students with colleges.
  • In recent searches, the ED froze significant amounts of money and seized evidences related to the inquiry.
“About 25,000 students were being referred by one entity and more than 10,000 students by another entity to various colleges based outside India every year.”

The ED's ongoing investigation emphasizes the serious nature of human trafficking and the exploitation of Indian nationals seeking migration opportunities.
newTitle: Over 260 Canadian Colleges Under Investigation for Trafficking Indians to the US

title: Kashmiri singer Ayan Sajad honored with Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar award - Greater Kashmir
summary:
Kashmiri singer Ayan Sajad honored with 'Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar' award

Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: Greater Kashmir

Ayan Sajad, a young prodigy from Anantnag, Jammu and Kashmir, has been awarded the prestigious Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar 2024 for his contributions in the field of Art and Culture.

The award is one of the highest honors for children in India, recognizing extraordinary accomplishments in various fields including innovation, social service, and art.

Ayan’s journey reflects his commitment to cultural heritage and creativity, inspiring many young artists in the region.

  • Ayan Sajad received the award from the President of India in a ceremony in New Delhi.
  • The recognition highlights the potential of young talents from Jammu and Kashmir.
  • Ayan aims to bridge cultural divides through his art and showcase the beauty of his heritage.
This award is a dream come true for me. It motivates me to work harder to preserve and promote the rich cultural heritage of Jammu and Kashmir through my art.

The honor serves as an inspiration for children across the region, urging more investments in nurturing young talents.
newTitle: Kashmiri singer Ayan Sajad honored with 'Pradhan Mantri Rashtriya Bal Puraskar' award
